name: Triphalangeal Thumb Syndrome with Radial Polydactyly
chief_complaint: My baby's thumb looks abnormal and has an extra finger on the side

lab_results.X-ray: bifid first metacarpal with duplicated proximal phalanx

prognosis: Good functional outcome with early surgical intervention, though may require multiple staged procedures
description: A rare congenital hand anomaly characterized by a thumb with three phalanges (instead of two) accompanied by preaxial (radial) polydactyly. This results from abnormal differentiation of the radial ray during embryonic development. The condition often requires complex reconstruction to create a functional, opposable thumb.
risk_factors: familial history of radial ray anomalies
